title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.34 part 1 | 13-09-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Yudhishthira Maharaj is very, very conscientious. He is not comfortable with his acquired position because it involved a killing, mass killing of so many millions of Kshatriyas soldiers.
segments.summary: This segment explains Yudhishthira's fear and desire to perform the Ashwamedha sacrifice to atone for the sins of the Kurukshetra war.

segments.key_quote: Sometimes the wealth is considered an impediment in spiritual progress.
segments.summary: This segment discusses the contrast between Vedic times, where people were satisfied with basic needs and focused on spiritual goals, and modern civilization, which is driven by sense gratification and material pursuits, also mentioning how wealth should be used.

segments.key_quote: The defect of the modern civilization is that people simply know one thing in life, sense gratification.
segments.summary: This segment explains how Yudhishthira utilized the unclaimed gold for sacrifice and contrasts the contentment of people in the past with the modern focus on industrial enterprise and sense gratification, leading to material bondage.

segments.key_quote: One should take lessons from the acts of Maharaj Yudhishthira. He was afraid of sins committed on the battlefield, and therefore he wanted to satisfy the supreme authority.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes the importance of taking lessons from Yudhishthira's example, highlighting his fear of sins and his desire to satisfy the Supreme Lord through sacrifice, even for unintentional actions.

segments.key_quote: Therefore, the main purpose of performing sacrifices is to satisfy the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Lord Hari.
segments.summary: This segment explains the importance of performing sacrifices as recommended in the scriptures to counteract sinful reactions and satisfy the Supreme Lord, leading to peace and prosperity.
